12:28 a geologist in Switzerland. ‎알베르트 하임이었죠
12:31 While climbing in the Alps, he had fallen... ‎그는 알프스산맥을 오르던 도중 ‎추락한 적이 있는데
12:33 and had a beautiful experience as he was falling down the mountain. ‎그때 아주 굉장한 경험을 ‎했던 것입니다
12:38 He described time expanding as he went faster and faster. ‎그는 점점 빨리 떨어지는 동안의 ‎시간 확장에 대해 묘사했습니다
12:42 And he was so struck by this experience ‎그리고 그 경험에 푹 빠져서
12:44 that he started asking other mountain climbers, ‎다른 등반가들에게도 물어
12:46 and quickly collected 30 other cases like his ‎자신처럼 높은 곳에서 떨어지면서
12:49 of people who had falls from great heights who had blissful experiences. ‎행복한 경험을 한 이들의 사례를 ‎금세 30건이나 수집했죠
12:55 And then in the 1960s and '70s, ‎그러다 1960년대, 70년대에
12:57 resuscitation medicine really got started. ‎소생 의학이 출범했습니다
13:00 [man] External chest compression is the best rescue technique ‎구조 기술 중 ‎인공 순환에 가장 효과적인 건
13:04 for artificial circulation. ‎외부 흉부 압박입니다
13:06 [Bruce] Which means we were bringing people back ‎죽음의 문턱에 간 사람들을 ‎점점 더 많이
13:08 from the brink of death in larger and larger numbers. ‎죽음의 문턱에 간 사람들을 ‎점점 더 많이 ‎데려오게 됐다는 거죠
